body:
**Bocha baseUrl not normalized**

`runBochaSearch` calls `fetch(params.baseUrl, ...)` directly, but `baseUrl` is documented/configured as a "base URL" (and `resolvePerplexityBaseUrl` normalizes by appending a path). If a user sets `tools.web.search.bocha.baseUrl` to something like `https://api.bocha.cn` (or adds a trailing slash), this will hit the wrong endpoint and always fail. Either treat this as an endpoint URL everywhere (rename/help text) or normalize it similarly (e.g., `new URL('/v1/web-search', baseUrl)` / strip+append path) before fetching.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/agents/tools/web-search.ts
Line: 420:424

Comment:
**Bocha baseUrl not normalized**

`runBochaSearch` calls `fetch(params.baseUrl, ...)` directly, but `baseUrl` is documented/configured as a "base URL" (and `resolvePerplexityBaseUrl` normalizes by appending a path). If a user sets `tools.web.search.bocha.baseUrl` to something like `https://api.bocha.cn` (or adds a trailing slash), this will hit the wrong endpoint and always fail. Either treat this as an endpoint URL everywhere (rename/help text) or normalize it similarly (e.g., `new URL('/v1/web-search', baseUrl)` / strip+append path) before fetching.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>

Good catch! Fixed in b1d7533 â€” now using `new URL("/v1/web-search", baseUrl)` to normalize, and updated the default to `https://api.bocha.cn` (base origin only). This handles trailing slashes and missing paths correctly.
